what: Name of tables in cached databases
title: How caching works in tidywikidatar
text: database table language type content. example, item information retrieved tw_get(id = "Q180099", language = "en") stored table called tw_item_en. caching local SQLite database, type contents (e.g. “item” “property” “search”) language stored separate file. caching another database, e.g. SQL, tables stored inside single database. either case, name table unique generated tw_get_cache_table_name(). example:
code: tw_get_cache_table_name(type = "item", language = "en") #> [1] "tw_item_en"

title: Explore Wikidata Through Tidy Data Frames
text: tidywikidatar strives strike balance ease use full access information available Wikidata. means , examples, dates returned simple text strings, without accompanying details calendar (e.g. Julian Gregorian) precision (e.g. precise just level century). amounts returned numeric strings, without accompanying unit measurement. user aware issues use cases, consider using packages matters determinant . Recent versions tidywikidatar include dedicated function get details, tw_get_property_with_details(), currently cache results. tidywikidatar useful particular exploratory analysis relatively small numbers wikidata items (dozens hundreds), becomes quickly less efficient asking many properties thousands items. Functions take time, eventually complete. performance improvements may come future versions tidywikidatar, larger batches data (large number items/many properties), well formed queries remain efficient.

One main distinction keep mind context properties really just expect single value, happy dismiss values may present, cases expect want retain values. example, Wikidata items two reported dates birth single individual, possibly due disagreements among historians actual date birth given person. specifically issue interested , may well want just keep first reported date birth dismiss others. cases, probably want retain properties, process subsequent steps pipe. Let’s look issues example. anthropologist Franz Boas (Q76857) many influential doctoral students (P185), including -mentioned Margaret Mead. others? born? expect answer latter questions unique, may fine discarding values may recorded Wikidata. cases, however, expect multiple valid values. example, expect single place date birth, quite possibly worked different locations different points career. may want go want, example, create map universities one Franz Boas’ doctoral students worked. get id places worked, check universities , get coordinates given institutions. Starting version 0.5, reduce typing, tw_get_property_same_length() now alias, tw_get_p(), can used stead.
code: library("dplyr", warn.conflicts = FALSE) library("tidyr") students <-   tw_get_property(id = "Q76857", p = "P185") %>%  # who were Boas' doctoral students?   transmute(student_label = tw_get_label(value), # get their name                    student_id = value) # and keep their id   students %>%     mutate(date_of_birth = tw_get_property_same_length(id = student_id,                                                      p = "P569", # property for date of birth                                                      only_first = TRUE)) %>%   # we don't care about possible multiple values on when they were born   mutate(place_of_birth = tw_get_property_same_length(id = student_id,                                                      p = "P19", # property for place of birth                                                      only_first = TRUE) %>%             tw_get_label()) #> # A tibble: 20 × 4 #>    student_label                 student_id date_of_birth         place_of_birth #>    <chr>                         <chr>      <chr>                 <chr>          #>  1 Ruth Benedict                 Q228822    +1887-06-05T00:00:00Z New York City  #>  2 Edward Sapir                  Q191095    +1884-01-26T00:00:00Z Lębork         #>  3 Alexander Francis Chamberlain Q32178     +1865-01-01T00:00:00Z Kenninghall    #>  4 Manuel Gamio                  Q2602445   +1883-01-01T00:00:00Z Mexico City    #>  5 Alexander Goldenweiser        Q1396805   +1880-01-29T00:00:00Z Kyiv           #>  6 Irving Goldman                Q6074597   +1911-09-02T00:00:00Z <NA>           #>  7 Melville J. Herskovits        Q711288    +1895-09-10T00:00:00Z Bellefontaine  #>  8 George Herzog                 Q15454430  +1901-12-11T00:00:00Z Budapest       #>  9 E. Adamson Hoebel             Q5321710   +1906-01-01T00:00:00Z Madison        #> 10 Melville Jacobs               Q6813885   +1902-07-03T00:00:00Z New York City  #> 11 William Jones                 Q8013732   +1871-00-00T00:00:00Z <NA>           #> 12 Alfred L. Kroeber             Q311538    +1876-06-11T00:00:00Z Hoboken        #> 13 Alexander Lesser              Q4719396   +1902-01-01T00:00:00Z <NA>           #> 14 Robert Lowie                  Q44968     +1883-06-12T00:00:00Z Vienna         #> 15 Margaret Mead                 Q180099    +1901-12-16T00:00:00Z Philadelphia   #> 16 Paul Radin                    Q557443    +1883-04-02T00:00:00Z Łódź           #> 17 Gladys Reichard               Q15998733  +1893-07-17T00:00:00Z Bangor         #> 18 Leslie Spier                  Q6531152   +1893-12-13T00:00:00Z <NA>           #> 19 Ruth Sawtell Wallis           Q7383203   +1895-03-15T00:00:00Z Springfield    #> 20 Edward A. Kennard             Q58050409  +1907-10-24T00:00:00Z <NA> students %>%    mutate(worked_at_id = tw_get_property_same_length(id = student_id,                                                      p = "P108", # property for employer                                                      only_first = FALSE)) %>% # not only the first result   unnest(worked_at_id) %>%   filter(is.na(worked_at_id)==FALSE) %>% # remove those for which we have no employer   mutate(worked_at_label = tw_get_label(worked_at_id)) %>%    # but keep in mind we are only interested in the employer if they are a university   # so we ask what `instance of` the employer is.    mutate(employer_instance_of = tw_get_property_same_length(id = worked_at_id,                                                             p = "P31",                                                             only_first = FALSE)) %>%     unnest(employer_instance_of) %>%    mutate(employer_instance_of_label = tw_get_label(employer_instance_of)) %>%    # some institutions may be e.g. "instance of" -> "private university", not of "university"   # so whe check what "subclass of" that id   mutate(employer_instance_of2 = tw_get_property_same_length(id = worked_at_id,                                                             p = "P31",                                                             only_first = FALSE)) %>%    unnest(employer_instance_of2) %>%    mutate(employer_instance_of2_subclass_of = tw_get_property_same_length(id = employer_instance_of2,                                                             p = "P279",                                                             only_first = FALSE)) %>%    unnest(employer_instance_of2_subclass_of) %>%    # keep only if employer is a university (or something which is a subclass of university)   filter(employer_instance_of == "Q3918" | employer_instance_of2_subclass_of == "Q3918") %>%    distinct(student_label, worked_at_id, worked_at_label) %>%    mutate(worked_at_coordinates = tw_get_property_same_length(worked_at_id,                                                              p = "P625",                                                              only_first = TRUE)) %>%    select(-worked_at_id) %>%    separate(worked_at_coordinates, into = c("lat", "lon"), sep = ",") #> # A tibble: 10 × 3 #>    id    property value                             #>    <chr> <chr>    <chr>                             #>  1 Q220  P17      Italy                             #>  2 Q220  P17      Papal States                      #>  3 Q220  P17      Kingdom of Italy                  #>  4 Q220  P17      Ostrogothic Kingdom               #>  5 Q220  P17      Byzantine Empire                  #>  6 Q220  P17      Kingdom of Italy                  #>  7 Q220  P17      Roman Kingdom                     #>  8 Q220  P17      Roman Republic                    #>  9 Q220  P17      Roman Empire                      #> 10 Q220  P17      Western Roman Empire (395-476 AD) tibble::tibble(city_qid = c("Q84", "Q220")) %>%    dplyr::mutate(city_label = tw_get_label(city_qid),                  country_qid = tw_get_p(id = city_qid,                                        p = "P17",                                        only_first = TRUE)) %>%    dplyr::mutate(country_label = tw_get_label(country_qid)) #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   city_qid city_label country_qid country_label #>   <chr>    <chr>      <chr>       <chr>         #> 1 Q84      London     Q2277       Roman Empire  #> 2 Q220     Rome       Q38         Italy tibble::tibble(city_qid = c("Q84", "Q220")) %>%    dplyr::mutate(city_label = tw_get_label(city_qid),                  country_qid = tw_get_p(id = city_qid,                                        p = "P17",                                        preferred = TRUE,                                        only_first = TRUE)) %>%    dplyr::mutate(country_label = tw_get_label(country_qid)) #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   city_qid city_label country_qid country_label  #>   <chr>    <chr>      <chr>       <chr>          #> 1 Q84      London     Q145        United Kingdom #> 2 Q220     Rome       Q38         Italy tibble::tibble(city_qid = c("Q84", "Q220")) %>%    dplyr::mutate(city_label = tw_get_label(city_qid),                  country_qid = tw_get_p(id = city_qid,                                        p = "P17",                                        latest_start_time = TRUE,                                         only_first = TRUE)) %>%    dplyr::mutate(country_label = tw_get_label(country_qid)) #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   city_qid city_label country_qid country_label  #>   <chr>    <chr>      <chr>       <chr>          #> 1 Q84      London     Q145        United Kingdom #> 2 Q220     Rome       Q38         Italy

title: Get Wikidata property of an item as a character vector of the same length as input — tw_get_property_same_length
code: # By default, it returns a list of the same length as input, # no matter how many values for each id/property tw_get_property_same_length(   id = c(     "Q180099",     "Q228822",     "Q76857"   ),   p = "P26" ) #> [[1]] #> [1] "Q314252"  "Q594736"  "Q2144944" #>  #> [[2]] #> [1] "Q2639508" #>  #> [[3]] #> [1] NA #>    if (interactive()) {   # Notice that if no relevant match is found, it returns a NA   # This is useful for piped operations    tibble::tibble(id = c(     "Q180099",     "Q228822",     "Q76857"   )) %>%     dplyr::mutate(spouse = tw_get_property_same_length(id, "P26"))    # Consider unnesting for further analysis    tibble::tibble(id = c(     "Q180099",     "Q228822",     "Q76857"   )) %>%     dplyr::mutate(spouse = tw_get_property_same_length(id, "P26")) %>%     tidyr::unnest(cols = spouse)    # If you are sure that you are interested only in the first return value,   # consider setting only_first=TRUE to get a character vector rather than a list   # Be mindful: you may well be discarding valid values.   tibble::tibble(id = c(     "Q180099",     "Q228822",     "Q76857"   )) %>%     dplyr::mutate(spouse = tw_get_property_same_length(id, "P26",       only_first = TRUE     )) } tw_get_p(id = "Q180099", "P26") #> [[1]] #> [1] "Q314252"  "Q594736"  "Q2144944" #>

title: tidywikidatar 0.1.0
text: outputs data frame vector caches data locally facilitates basic queries

title: tidywikidatar 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-04-19 efficient input includes repeated id better documentation testing

title: tidywikidatar 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-06-07 much efficient caching introduces partial compatibility caching backends via DBI introduces progress bars report informative error messages server tests fail without throwing errors Wikidata server reached new caching vignette

title: tidywikidatar 0.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-07-31 tw_get_label() actually returns vector length input introduce tw_get_property_same_length() easier integration piped operations introduce tw_get_property_with_details() extract additional details language unit property otherwise discarded tw_get_property(). tw_get_property_with_details(), however, (yet) cache results.

title: tidywikidatar 0.4.1
text: CRAN release: 2021-08-04 bug fix release: tw_get_label(), now actually always returns vector length input new functions used internally consistency preventing issue different scenarios invalid identifiers NA now ignored tw_get()

title: tidywikidatar 0.4.2
text: CRAN release: 2021-09-14 tw_get_image() now returns consistently valid links format set ‘embed’; now possible get direct link images given resolution width parameter introduce tw_get_image_metadata() obtain adequate credits included images used introduce functions get Wikidata identifiers Wikipedia pages tw_get_property() now consistently returns data frame properties order given fail given invalid values consistent testing, less likely impacted changes Wikidata items updated README examples using pipe operator

title: tidywikidatar 0.5.0
text: new feature: tw_get_qualifiers() now includes ranking “preferred”, “normal”, “deprecated” associated property, well value type output (new format incompatible previous cache) introduce tw_get_p() alias tw_get_property_same_length() brevity introduce new parameters tw_get_p() deal common pattern “preferred” recent property returned, rather whatever Wikidata first list, add new section readme add example datasets illustrative purposes forthcoming additional vignettes examples, tw_qid_meps tw_qid_airports drop legacy include_id_and_p parameter tw_get_qualifiers() bug fix: fix error Wikidata item label language
